news_header: Nokia restructures its communication and social relations activities, appointing new directors and announcing departures from the Group Management Team.
news_text: Nokia has divided its communication and social relations into distinct activities, including transport policy. Mikko Hautala has been appointed as Director of Transport Policy and Social Relations, reporting to CEO Pekka Lundmark. Luuise Fisk has been promoted to Communications Director. Hautala, based in Espoo, has extensive experience in social development and previously served as Finland’s Ambassador to the U.S. from 2020 to 2024. Melissa Schoeb and Jenni Lukander, both members of the Group Management Team, are leaving the company at the end of the year. Patrik Hammaren is temporarily overseeing the Technological Business Group until a successor for Lukander is found.
